alert.note: Alert for Humphreys; Issaquena; Leflore; Sharkey; Sunflower; Washington (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 19 at 4:19PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central East Carroll and east central West Carroll Parishes, southern Sunflower, Leflore, southeastern Washington, northwestern Issaquena, Humphreys and Sharkey Counties through 515 PM CST... At 419 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Holly Ridge to 7 miles south of Avon to near Shelburn. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Holly Ridge around 425 PM CST. Indianola around 430 PM CST. Hollandale, Moorhead, Sunflower and Estill around 435 PM CST. Darlove, Grace and Glen Allan around 440 PM CST. Rolling Fork around 445 PM CST. Itta Bena, Anguilla, Isola, Nitta Yuma and Panther Burn around 450 PM CST. Belzoni, Inverness and Delta City around 455 PM CST. Greenwood, Money and Murphy around 500 PM CST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Mayersville, Silver City, Arcola, Pioneer, Cary, Louise and Morgan City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CST for southeastern Arkansas...northeastern Louisiana...and central, north central, northwestern and west central Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: Humphreys; Issaquena; Leflore; Sharkey; Sunflower; Washington
